title: yasuo's ulti
body:
i was in an one for all game as {{champion:45}}  vs {{champion:157}} 

and appearnly he ulti counts as a "teleport" rather than a "dash" even though you can clearly see his model dash toward to your champ when he uses it.

now in the VAST majority of the cases in the game chaning it to a dash will have no effect.

i am not sure if he can cast it while rooted but imo he shouldn't be able to.

so only ground effect skills or insanely lucky aoes could hit him mid flight.

but it would aoffer some interesting and rare counterplay. as well as giving him at least once decently hard-counter in {{champion:45}} . (who btw i dont play)

replies.body: Yasuo's model does not move to cast his ulti. What you see "move" is simple a particle effect, there for fun / clarity / anime references. This is discernable by the fact that you cannot attack, displace / CC, or inflict any effects (positive or negative) on the particle as it travels.

Yasuos model is seen dashing, but his hitbox isn't.
the description (if unchanged) says that he teleports to an knocked up enemy.

agreed

also he can cast it when ziggs jumps with his w lol

But no. If they do change it from a blink to a dash, I'd say they'd need to give it the Warwick ult treatment. 

Yasuo ult is only canceled by his death and it should stay that way.
